org.team3309.friarlib

Class BangBangController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team3309.friarlib.BangBangController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class BangBangController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class contains code to control the speed of a wheel using bang-bang control. Bang-bang only works if the motor controller is jumpered for coast mode instead of brake mode. This should be the defualt for Victors. Do not use bang-bang with a Jaguar! Only Talons and Victors are supported.
    Author:
    Vinnie

      Constructors

      BangBangController(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController controller, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Counter encoder, int countsPerRev)
      Create a new bang-bang motor controller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BangBangController

        public BangBangController(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController controller,
                  edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Counter encoder,
                  int countsPerRev)
        Create a new bang-bang motor controller.
        Parameters:
        controller - the underlying speed controller (a Victor or Talon, no Jaguars)
        encoder - a Counter object for the speed sensor (usually a KOP photosensor)
        countsPerRev - how many counts the encoder reads per revolution

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enable the bang-bang controller. When enabled, the controller will run the motor to reach the desired rpm

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disable the bang-bang controller. When disabled, the motor is constantly run at 0.

      • setTargetRpm

        public void setTargetRpm(double rpm)
        Set the target speed of the wheel
        Parameters:
        rpm - the rpm of the wheel, this is independent of the number of counts per revolution

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
